page.title: 02GAZETTE P.TWO,COVE-FRIMLEY
page.content: This area also has a long tradition of connections with the{British Army } based at nearby Aldershot.Hawley Woods and Hawley Common, are used as an extensive training areas for the{Royal {Engineers.}Hawley lake is also used as an army sailing base and for military manoeuvres.The large concentration of infant,primary and secondary schools in the area were built to serve the expanding population .The local {Frimley Park hospital}serves the local area.To counteract the fact that so much land is now required for housing,part of the{Blackwater Valley} is now being developed as a nature reserve and recreation area. This once quiet rural backwater is in the 80's,a scene of continual and rapid change,and due to these changes has less{unemployment}than some other parts of the country at this time.
